step.context: \text{What will the sum of partial fractions look like?}
\text{In }\dfrac{2x}{\left(x^2 +1\right)\left(x^2 +3\right)} = \dfrac{Ax+B}{x^2 +1} +\dfrac{Cx+D}{x^3+3},\\ \text{What are the values of A, B, C and D?}
step.reason: \dfrac{2x}{\left(x^2 +1\right)\left(x^2 +3\right)} = \dfrac{Ax+B}{x^2 +1} +\dfrac{Cx+D}{x^3+3}\\ \implies 2x = \left(Ax+B\right)\left(x^2+B\right)+\left(Cx+D\right)\left(x^2+1\right)\\ =\left(A+C\right)x^3+\left(B+D\right)x^2+\left(3A+C\right)x+\left(3B+D\right)\\ \text{Comparing the coefficients } \\ \begin{tabular}{|c|c|} \hline x^3 & A+C =0\\ x^2 & B+D = 0\\ x & 3A +C = 2\\ x^0& 3B+D = 0\\ \hline \end{tabular}\\ \text{Which on solving }B = D =0 ,A =1 \text{ and } C = -1
